metadata.title: CVE-2024-26824 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: crypto:algif_hash - Remove bogus SGL free on zero-length error path When azero-length message is hashed by algif_hash, and an error is triggered, ittries to free an SG list that was never allocated in the first place. Fixthis by not freeing the SG list on the zero-length error path.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
